result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph P Clark was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court will allow expungement if defendant completes probation.
CASE CAN BE TRANSFERRED TO WAUKESHA COUNTY.

miscConds.notes:
Court ordered defendant to provide DNA, and pay all mandatory court costs, fees, surcharges, and assessments, while on probation. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. Defendant to make regular monthly payments.
Pay all supervision fees. Defendant to make regular monthly payments.
Maintain employment, school, or a combination of both.
No association with known drug users or dealers, and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.

Stay in some type of treatment during probation ( can be some type of AA program also).
Maintain absolute sobriety, no alcohol, no controlled substances without a valid prescription, with random drug tests and breathalyzers.

IMPOSED and STAYED. To be used by the agent for any violations.

records.addlTxt:
Filed, Petition for Civil Judgment for Court Ordered Financial Obligations.  

The COURT FINDS, ORDERS, AND ADJUDGES:

COURT COSTS:
Judgment is granted against the defendant for unpaid court ordered financial obligations in the amount of $303.90.  The clerk is directed to enter this judgment on the judgment and lien docket without fee.  Interest will be added from the date of entry of judgment at the rate allowed by statute.

*copy to agent and district attorney*

Pursuant to current District Court Rules, this case is assigned and 
forwarded to Judge Swanson
for review. os

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joseph P Clark in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements given by the state, defense, and the defendant.  

Court sentenced defendant to serve 1 YEAR in the House of Correction.  COURT ORDERED NO RELEASE PRIVILEDGES.  Court gives credit for 0 days served. 
Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 2 YEARS with the following conditions:  

CASE CAN BE TRANSFERRED TO WAUKESHA COUNTY.

- 60 DAYS, IMPOSED and STAYED, CONSECUTIVE in the House of Correction to be used by the agent for any violations.  
- Stay in some type of treatment during probation.  (can be some type of AA program also)
- Maintain absolute sobriety, no alcohol, no controlled substances without a valid prescription, with random drug tests and breathalyzers.  
- Maintain employment, school, or a combination of both.
- No association with known drug users or dealers, and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
- Complete 50 hours of community service at a non profit organization.
- Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA, and pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, surcharges, and assessments, while on probation.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  Defendant to make regular monthly payments.
- Pay all supervision fees.  Defendant to make regular monthly payments.

Court will allow EXPUNGEMENT if defenandant completes probation.

Received and filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.  aw

Defendant Joseph P Clark in court with attorney Victoria M. McCandless.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case adjourned due to the lateness of the hour.  Case adjourned for sentencing on 1/7/2015 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.  aw  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Joseph P Clark in court with attorney Victoria M. McCandless.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Patricia Daugherty.
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.
Case adjourned for sentencing on 11/24/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3. 
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, received and filed.  aw
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Joseph P Clark in court with attorney Victoria M. McCandless.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court is in trial.  Defense cousnel has no motions to be filed.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 8/21/2014 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.  aw

Defendant Joseph P Clark in court with attorney Victoria M McCandless.  Stephan E Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Patricia Daugherty.
State to provide discovery and an offer to attorney attorney McCandless.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 7/11/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Joseph P Clark in court with attorney Victoria M McCandless.  Nathaniel Adamson for Patricia I Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 3:00 P.M. ON  (5-22-2014). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Nicole V., Ryan K.S. and Joshua W.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Joseph P Clark in court with attorney Victoria M McCandless.  Katryna L Childs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES  QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.   Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 2, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 5/21/14 @ 1:30pm
